Pre-Game Insights: Wales will take on Turkey in the UEFA Nations League on 06/09/2024 at Cardiff City Stadium, Cardiff.
Wales are under the guidance of a new manager, Craig Bellamy, who replaced Rob Page.
Bellamy's appointment brings both uncertainty and optimism for Welsh fans.
Wales have won three of their last five home games and are unbeaten in their last five home games, excluding penalty shootouts.
Turkey reached the quarter-finals of Euro 2024 under Vincenzo Montella, marking their best tournament performance in over 15 years.
Turkey's recent success has created a positive atmosphere around the team, and they aim to build on this momentum in the Nations League.
Turkey's squad includes promising young talent like 17-year-old Mustafa Hekimoğlu.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game will be televised live to all UK viewers on SC4.
Wales' Dan James is out injured, and Ipswich pair Wes Burns and Nathan Broadhead are both unavailable.
18-year-old Lewis Koumas may make his first start for Wales.
Turkey's Ferdi Kadıoğlu is unavailable due to a delayed transfer to Brighton & Hove Albion, and Ahmetcan Kaplan is also unavailable.
Bertug Yildirim and Merih Demiral will miss out due to suspensions carried over from Euro 2024.
